openadk.library.threadpool
Interface IThreadPoolDelayTask

All Known Implementing Classes:
HttpPullProtocolHandler
public interface IThreadPoolDelayTask

Interface used in conjunction with ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor tasks that are scheduled with a fixed delay. This allows individual tasks to dynamically change the delay time before the next scheduled run of the task.

Method Summary
 int getScheduleDelay()
          Gets the number of milliseconds to delay the next run of the task.
 

Method Detail

getScheduleDelay

int getScheduleDelay()
Gets the number of milliseconds to delay the next run of the task. The ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor calls this method immediately after the tasks run() method returns to set the delay period for the next run of the task. A return value of 0 will queue the task to run on the next available thread. A negative value will remove the task from the thread pool.

Returns:
Number of milliseconds to delay before next run of the task.
